books.title: You Don't Know JS: Up & Going First
books.description: It’s easy to learn parts of JavaScript, but much harder to learn it completely or even sufficiently whether you’re new to the language or have used it for years. books.title: You Don't Know JS: This & Object Proto
books.description: No matter how much experience you have with JavaScript, odds are you don't fully understand the language. This concise, in depth guide takes you inside JavaScript's this structure and object prototypes. books.title: You Don't Know JS: Types & Grammar
books.description: Get acquainted with JavaScript’s seven types: null, undefined, boolean, number, string, object, and symbol. books.title: Lolita by Vladimir Nabokov
books.description: The book is internationally famous for its innovative style and infamous for its controversial subject: the protagonist and unreliable narrator, middle aged Humbert Humbert, becomes obsessed.

books.title: Crime and Punishment by Fyodor Dostoyevsky

books.title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland by Lewis Carroll
books.description: In 1862 Charles Lutwidge Dodgson, a shy Oxford mathematician with a stammer, created a story about a little girl tumbling down a rabbit hole. Thus began the immortal adventures of Alice, perhaps.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen
books.description: The book is narrated in free indirect speech following the main character Elizabeth Bennet as she deals with matters of upbringing, marriage, moral rightness and education in her aristocratic socie.

books.title: To the Lighthouse by Virginia Woolf

books.title: Heart of Darkness by Joseph Conrad
books.description: The story details an incident when Marlow, an Englishman, took a foreign assignment from a Belgian trading company as a ferry-boat captain in Africa. Although Conrad does not specify the name.

books.title: Anna Karenina by Leo Tolstoy
books.description: Anna Karenina tells of the doomed love affair between the sensuous and rebellious Anna and the dashing officer, Count Vronsky. Tragedy unfolds as Anna rejects her passionless marriage and must end.

books.title: Great Expectations by Charles Dickens
books.description: Great Expectations is written in the genre of bildungsroman or the style of book that follows the story of a man or woman in their quest for maturity, usually starting from childhood and ending.

books.title: One Thousand and One Nights by India
books.description: One Thousand and One Nights is a collection of Middle Eastern and South Asian stories and folk tales compiled in Arabic during the Islamic Golden Age. It is often known in English as the Arabian Nicea.
